Title: Scrutinizing SpaceX, NASA Overlooked Some Boeing Software Problems
Author: Kenneth Chang
Summary: The agency identified the causes of mishaps in orbit during an uncrewed test flight of its Starliner spacecraft in December.

Title: Could You Make a Snowball of Neutrinos?
Author: Randall Munroe
Summary: You’ll need more than a few — say, 300 decillion. And good luck trying to throw it.

Title: Last Testament of Maurice the Rooster
Author: Roger Cohen
Summary: Cultivate your garden. That never disappoints.

Title: Two Black Holes Colliding Not Enough? Make It Three
Author: Dennis Overbye
Summary: Astronomers claim to have seen a flash from the merger of two black holes within the maelstrom of a third, far bigger one.

Title: A Black Hole’s Lunch Provides a Treat for Astronomers
Author: Dennis Overbye
Summary: Scientists have discovered the heaviest known neutron star, or maybe the lightest known black hole: “Either way it breaks a record.”

Title: Mars Is About to Have Its ‘Wright Brothers Moment’
Author: Kenneth Chang
Summary: As part of its next Mars mission, NASA is sending an experimental helicopter to fly through the red planet’s thin atmosphere.

Title: Small Worlds With Lava Oceans Might Have Given Us Meteorites
Author: Jonathan O’Callaghan
Summary: Researchers propose a new model to explain the formation of most of the meteorites that make it to Earth.

Title: Summer Solstice 2020 and the Search for Life in the Galaxy
Author: Shannon Hall
Summary: As you mark the longest day of the year, consider the debate among astronomers over whether Earth’s tilt toward the sun helps make life on our world and others possible.

Title: They Want to Sell Balloon Rides 19 Miles Up. Haven’t We Heard This Before?
Author: Kenneth Chang
Summary: Seven years ago, entrepreneurs planned trips to the stratosphere, but tourists never got off the ground. They’re trying again.

Title: Seeking Dark Matter, They Detected Another Mystery
Author: Dennis Overbye
Summary: Do signals from beneath an Italian mountain herald a revolution in physics?
